TopicTitle: Which is the real KSP water?

Articles.Content:
KSP has two waters. Pool and ocean. Which one is the real water off KSP? I think ocean water is the real one. Post your thoughts in a reply

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-04T14:28:54Z" title="07/04/2015 02:28  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 4, 2015</time> by 322997am**

pool water is fake ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

and ocean one is the deadliest thing in the universe
Classifying the pool as water is an insult to water.
Yes, but the pool water acts like real life water with parts.

> 
> Yes, but the pool water acts like real life water with parts.

As in, having no effect at all?
Sinking?
The old hard water oceans.
Did you know KSC is actually floating on water? That's why your rockets keep wobbling.
The ocean must be very salty.

Have you really made this thread just because of [this](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126974-Submarine-Industries?p=2047673&viewfull=1#post2047673) post? I think it was a joke. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
I'll stick with the ocean... I hear tell Kerbals tend to pee in the pool.
The Ocean is real, because KSP can differ from real life.

Water ain't cheap. You'd think it'd be easy to fill up the pool with water from the nearby ocean, but noooo, it doesn't work like that.

They need every bit of water they've got for more important things, so they fake the pool's water using a hologram.

> 
> Sinking?

Parts don't sink in the pool. They move through it as though there's nothing there, because there's nothing there.

> 
> I'll stick with the ocean... I hear tell Kerbals tend to pee in the pool.

So I wasn't totally wrong when my rover got stuck on the edge because I wanted to test whether the pool was a bio-me.
The one with two Hydrogen atoms and a Oxygen atom.
The ocean is the one that is supposed to be water, although it's not very watery water.

Depends on what you count as water, only the H2O, because then it is both water, if you count sea water as water then only the ocean and if you choose fresh water as real water then I should try to find that ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I'd say it's both water

There is only one water; ocean water. Anyone telling you otherwise is a pool-water traitor and should be ignored. *All hail ocean water.* this post is rated F for funny.

> 
> The water in the pool at the KSC has no collision, the ocean water does. The pool water is literally just a texture, you fall right through it.

As i wrote in the description of the Albatross water landing plane in my craftfile thread: "all these waters are yours to explore, except the KSC swimming pool - attempt no landing here" - So it can only be ocean...
Even though it does not act like water I still prefer the look of the pool water.
but there are more options ... you can get desert water, grassland water, badlands water ... just have to be sneaky (it counts as new science data for surface samples!)

> 
> I'll stick with the ocean... I hear tell Kerbals tend to pee in the pool.

"Somebody poisoned the water hole!" --- *Woody Kerman[i*

> 
> Even though it does not act like water I still prefer the look of the pool water.

It's the only thing in the Kerbal universe that has reflections. Without mods.
Obviously the pool, **it has the original textures from the old KSP versions.**
